clinical_study.brief_title: Study of NGM707 as Monotherapy and in Combination With Pembrolizumab in Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumor Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2 Dose Escalation/Expansion Study of NGM707 as Monotherapy and in Combination With Pembrolizumab in Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumor Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: Study of NGM707 as Monotherapy and in Combination with Pembrolizumab in Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumor Malignancies

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients with Dose-limiting Toxicities
primary_outcome.description: A DLT is defined as an AE that meets at least one of the criteria listed in protocol, according to National Cancer Institute (NCI) common terminology criteria for AE (CTCAE) version 5.0, and is considered by the investigator to be clinically relevant and attributed to the study treatment during the first 28 days after the first dose of study treatment.

Number of patients with adverse events (AEs) according to severity, seriousness, and relationship to study drug An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant, temporally associated with the use of study treatment, whether or not considered related to the study treatment. The number of patients who experience at least one AE will be presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients with Clinically Significant Laboratory Abnormalities
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with clinically significant change from baseline in laboratory abnormalities as characterized by type, frequency, severity (graded by CTCAE version 5.0) and timing.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients in Expansion Cohorts with Objective Responses
primary_outcome.description: Objective Response Rate is defined as the proportion of patients who achieve a confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to RECIST v1.1

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response for Patients in Expansion Cohorts
primary_outcome.description: Duration of Response is defined as the time from the first documentation of objective response (CR or PR) that is subsequently confirmed per RECIST v1.1, to the time of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression-free Survival for Patients in Expansion Cohorts
primary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival is defined as the time from start of study treatment to the date of first documentation of objective tumor progression on or following study therapy per RECIST v1.1, or to death due to any cause, whichever comes first.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival for Patients in Combination Dose Expansion Cohorts
primary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the date from start of the study treatment to the date of death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Observed Plasma Concentration of NGM707 (Including Cmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Will be measured on Day 1, 2, 4, 8 and 15 of Cycles 1 and 3, Day 1 of Cycle 2 and Day 1 of Cycle 4 and each cycle thereafter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Plasma NGM707
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the curve from time zero extrapolated to the last quantifiable dose of NGM707. Time zero extrapolated to the last quantifiable time point prior to the next dose. Will be measured on Day 1, 2, 4, 8 and 15 of Cycles 1 and 3, Day 1 of Cycle 2 and Day 1 of Cycle 4 and each cycle thereafter.

Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half. Will be measured on Day 1, 2, 4, 8 and 15 of Cycles 1 and 3, Day 1 of Cycle 2 and Day 1 of Cycle 4 and each cycle thereafter.
Incidence and titers of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) against NGM707. Will be measured on Day 1 of each cycle.

clinical_study.condition: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically documented locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor malignancy.
- Progressed or was intolerant to all available therapies known to confer clinical benefit appropriate for their tumor type, and for which the patient was eligible and willing to receive, or refused SOC treatments that are perceived to have marginal clinical benefit.
- Adequate bone marrow, kidney and liver function.
- Performance status of 0 or 1.
- Resolved acute effects of any prior therapy to baseline severity or CTCAE Grade 1 except for AEs not constituting a safety risk by Investigator judgement.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior treatment targeting ILT2 and/or ILT4 or targeting HLA-G.

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
